page.title: 09Wilson
page.content: The village of Wilson lies just within Leicstershire. It's only amenity is a pub, the Bulls Head which serves excellent meals and attracts customers from the surrounding area and groups of ramblers at weekends. For all other amenities and services the residents must travel to Breedon or Melbourne. The young children are taken by bus to Breedon Junior School and the older ones to Shepshed. There being no central hall for social and community activities, a group of residents hope to gain permission to use a small disused chapel as a day centre. Occasional village events are organised by two families who each have large gardens. Part time seasonal and casual employment is provided at a local market garden where vegetables are trimmed and packed for sale.
